intro: Stichorkis loliacea, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Stichorkis loliacea is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
